prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be a research student. She's camped out to photograph shooting stars.
Character 4
Name: Larry Butz
Description: A friend and former classmate. Also my first client. Often the cause of trouble.
Character 5
Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.
Character 6
Name: Robert Hammond
Description: The victim in this case. Also, the defense attorney in the DL-6 Incident.
Character 7
Name: Misty Fey
Description: Mia and Maya's mother, and a spirit medium. Disappeared after the DL-6 Incident.
Character 8
Name: Gregory Edgeworth
Description: Victim in the DL-6 Incident, 15 years ago. A defense attorney and Miles's father.
Character 9
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: Veteran prosecutor who hasn't lost a case in his 40-year career. Edgeworth's mentor.
Character 10
Name: Old Caretaker → Yanni Yogi
Description: Caretaker of the boat rental shop in Gourd Lake Park. Thinks he runs a restaurant.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Popper
Description: A classic party noisemaker. Pull the string, it goes "bang". Not very clue-worthy.
Evidence 2
Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: Set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected. Faces the lake.
Evidence 3
Name: Autopsy Report → Robert's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Cause: one bullet shot to the heart. Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Shot from approximately one meter away.
Evidence 4
Name: Lake Photo
Description: Taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. [caption] One person is holding a gun and firing at another person. The fog is so dense that neither of the men's faces can be seen clearly.
Evidence 5
Name: Gourdy Article
Description: Article about a monster sighted at Gourd Lake. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Misty Fey's Photo
Description: An old photograph. "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" is written on the back.
Evidence 7
Name: Edgeworth's Request
Description: Document proving Edgeworth's request for an attorney.
Evidence 8
Name: Overhead Map
Description: Overhead map of Gourd Lake. Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol Bullet
Description: Found in the victim's body. Fired from a 22-caliber pistol. Found in the victim's body. The ballistic markings match the murder weapon's barrel.
Evidence 10
Name: Pistol
Description: The murder weapon. 22-caliber. Fired 3 times. Bears prints from Edgeworth's right hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Lotta's Deposition
Description: "I heard two sounds like gunshots just after midnight on 12/25."
Evidence 12
Name: Missile
Description: A K-9 unit in training. Very cute, with shiny eyes.
Evidence 13
Name: Fishing Pole
Description: Detective Gumshoe's personal fishing pole. Sadly flimsy and of dubious utility.
Evidence 14
Name: Metal Detector
Description: Makes a noise when metallic objects are near. A useful detection device.
Evidence 15
Name: Air Tank
Description: An empty air tank. The valve is open, and a banner of flags is wrapped around it.
Evidence 16
Name: Second Lake Photo
Description: Shows an empty lake. Taken automatically on 12/24 at 11:50 PM.
Evidence 17
Name: Parrot
Description: The erstwhile companion of the boat rental shop caretaker. Answers to the name "Polly".
Evidence 18
Name: DL-6 Case File
Description: File on the DL-6 Incident. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: DL-6 Incident Photo
Description: Photograph of the scene of the murder. Click here for details.
Evidence 20
Name: Letter from the Safe
Description: "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth." This note details the murder and set up.
Evidence 21
Name: DL-6 Bullet
Description: Taken from Gregory Edgeworth's heart. Still bears clear ballistic markings.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw it clear as day. The man on the boat was Mr. Edgeworth!
Person: Lotta

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. Let's start by going through the testimonies first.

Testimony 0 is from Lotta Hart. She says, "I saw it clear as day. The man on the boat was Mr. Edgeworth!" So Lotta claims she clearly saw Edgeworth on the boat. Now, looking at the evidences related to her. Evidence 2 is Lotta's Camera, which was set to take pictures automatically when a loud noise is detected. The Lake Photo (Evidence 4) taken at 12:15 AM on 12/25 shows two people, but the faces are unclear due to fog. 

Wait, Lotta's testimony says she saw Edgeworth clearly, but her own camera's photo (Evidence 4) shows the faces aren't clear because of the dense fog. That's a contradiction. She can't have seen him clearly if the photo from her camera shows the fog obscuring their faces. Also, the Second Lake Photo (Evidence 16) taken earlier at 11:50 PM shows the lake empty, so maybe that's not directly contradicting. But the main point is that her testimony claims clarity, while her camera's photo (Evidence 4) shows the fog making faces unclear. So the evidence contradicting her testimony would be Evidence 4. But wait, Testimony 0 is Testimony 0, so in the JSON, the testimony number is 0. The evidence number for the Lake Photo is 4. So the pair would be {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 0}.

Let me double-check. Testimony 0 by Lotta says she saw Edgeworth clearly. Evidence 4's description states the fog is dense, so faces can't be seen clearly. This directly contradicts her statement. Therefore, the correct answer is evidence 4 and testimony 0.

Testimony 2
Testimony: Still, I brought my binoculars with me.
Person: Lotta
Testimony 3
Testimony: The camera was set up to take pictures of a meteor shower.
Person: Lotta
Testimony 4
Testimony: When I heard that noise out on the lake, I looked with my binoculars.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to pick one pair where the evidence contradicts the testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies. The testimonies are from Lotta Hart. Testimony 3 says, "The camera was set up to take pictures of a meteor shower." That's testimony index 3. Now, looking at the evidences, Evidence 2 is Lotta's Camera, which is described as being set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected, facing the lake. 

Wait, so the testimony claims the camera was for a meteor shower, but the evidence states it's triggered by loud noises. That seems contradictory. If the camera was set up for a meteor shower, you'd expect it to take photos at timed intervals or based on motion in the sky, not triggered by loud sounds. But the evidence says it's activated by loud noises. That's a contradiction because the purpose stated in the testimony (meteor shower) doesn't align with the actual trigger mechanism (loud noise) as per the evidence. 

So, the pair would be Evidence 2 (Lotta's Camera) and Testimony 3. That's the contradiction. Let me double-check other possibilities to be sure. 

Testimony 4 mentions using binoculars when she heard a noise. Evidence 2's camera took photos automatically when loud noises happened, which resulted in the Lake Photo (Evidence 4). But that's not a contradiction. The main issue is between the camera's trigger (loud noise) and the stated purpose (meteor shower). Yes, that's the key point. So the answer should be evidence 2 and testimony 3.
